nodes.documentation:
@title ERC20 interface
@dev see https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-20
nodes.name: IERC20

nodes.documentation:
@title SafeMath
@dev Unsigned math operations with safety checks that revert on error
nodes.name: SafeMath

nodes.documentation: @dev Multiplies two unsigned integers, reverts on overflow.
nodes.name: mul

nodes.documentation: @dev Integer division of two unsigned integers truncating the quotient, reverts on division by zero.
nodes.name: div

nodes.documentation: @dev Subtracts two unsigned integers, reverts on overflow (i.e. if subtrahend is greater than minuend).
nodes.name: sub

nodes.documentation: @dev Adds two unsigned integers, reverts on overflow.
nodes.name: add

nodes.documentation:
@dev Divides two unsigned integers and returns the remainder (unsigned integer modulo),
reverts when dividing by zero.
nodes.name: mod

nodes.documentation: Utility library of inline functions on addresses
nodes.name: Address
isContract

nodes.documentation:
@title SafeERC20
@dev Wrappers around ERC20 operations that throw on failure (when the token
contract returns false). Tokens that return no value (and instead revert or
throw on failure) are also supported, non-reverting calls are assumed to be
successful.
To use this library you can add a `using SafeERC20 for ERC20;` statement to your contract,
which allows you to call the safe operations as `token.safeTransfer(...)`, etc.
nodes.name: SafeERC20
callOptionalReturn
Ownable

nodes.documentation:
@dev The Ownable constructor sets the original `owner` of the contract to the sender
account.
@return the address of the owner.
nodes.name: owner

nodes.documentation: @dev Throws if called by any account other than the owner.
nodes.name: onlyOwner

nodes.documentation: @return true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.
nodes.name: isOwner
renounceOwnership

nodes.documentation:
@dev Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.
@param newOwner The address to transfer ownership to.
nodes.name: transferOwnership

nodes.documentation:
@dev Transfers control of the contract to a newOwner.
@param newOwner The address to transfer ownership to.
nodes.name: _transferOwnership
ARDTokenVesting

nodes.documentation: @return the beneficiary of the tokens.
nodes.name: beneficiary

nodes.documentation: Starts the token vesting process.
nodes.name: startVesting

nodes.documentation: @return the start time of the token vesting.
nodes.name: start

nodes.documentation: @return the duration of the token vesting.
nodes.name: duration

nodes.documentation: @return the amount of the token released.
nodes.name: released

nodes.documentation:
@notice Transfers vested tokens to beneficiary.
@param token ERC20 token which is being vested
nodes.name: release

nodes.documentation:
@dev Calculates the amount that has already vested but hasn't been released yet.
@param token ERC20 token which is being vested
nodes.name: _releasableAmount

nodes.documentation:
@dev Calculates the amount that has already vested.
@param token ERC20 token which is being vested
nodes.name: _vestedAmount

devdoc.details: The Ownable contract has an owner address, and provides basic authorization control functions, this simplifies the implementation of "user permissions".

constructor.details: The Ownable constructor sets the original `owner` of the contract to the sender account.

isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the current owner to relinquish control of the contract. It will not be possible to call the functions with the `onlyOwner` modifier anymore.

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

devdoc.title: Ownable

renounceOwnership().notice: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.
